text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Libyan leader Muammer Gaddafi insults Turkey in front of its prime minister and a delegation visiting his country. Gaddafi criticised Turkey's treatment of its Kurds.
- Turkish troops killed 18 Kurdish rebel in Sivas province in the heartland of Anatolia.
- Foreign Minister Tansu Ciller, angered by Gaddafi's comments about Turkey, asked Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan not to sign any agreement with Libya. The demand was rebuffed by Erbakan.
- Police detain 22 people in Istanbul demonstrating against treatment of Kurdish and left-wing prisoners.
- Gaddafi openly expresses his support for Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) rebels during Erbakan's visit to Libya.
- Armed forces denies having given a memorandum of warning to President Suleyman Demirel and says it stays out of politics.
- Record application to energy ministry tenders for the building of power plants.
- Istanbul's Islamist town hall tries to forbid use of historical sites for cultural activities likes music concerts.
- Government spokesman Abdullah Gul says Gaddafi's criticism of Turkey is nonsense.
